In the 1950s a woman called Mary Ainsworth studied attchment alongside her collegue John Bowlby.
There studies along with others before them have demonstrated the importance of attachment between infant and mother.
WHY are theese studies which are percieved as influential still not adhered to in ways that allows humans to exist free from the pain, trauma and endless ongoing suffering that is caused when a new born baby is removed from the mothers care at BIRTH.
Social workers are needed and the family in times of hardship shys away due to the deep cut fear that is having a child removed.
Child protection units would work in perfect harmony with up coming social workers training, the courts timesclales, adoption waiting lists and the rights of the child and birth families entitlement to family life, relaxation and being free from tourture. We have the child protection register so is now not a perfect time to unite and work IN THE BEST INTEREST OF THE CHILD!!!
